articles.title: Top OpenAI, Google Brain researchers set off a $300M VC frenzy for their startup Periodic Labs
articles.summary: When Liam Fedus announced he was quitting OpenAI, VCs swarmed.  One even wrote a love letter.
articles.content: When Liam Fedus announced he was quitting OpenAI, VCs swarmed. One even wrote a love letter. Here's how Felicis' Peter Deng won the deal.

articles.title: Meta AI’s app downloads and daily users spiked after launch of ‘Vibes’ AI video feed
articles.summary: New data from Similarweb shows Meta AI’s mobile app is surging in popularity, jumping from 775,000 to 2. 7 million daily active users in just four weeks.
articles.content: New data from Similarweb shows Meta AI’s mobile app is surging in popularity, jumping from 775,000 to 2.7 million daily active users in just four weeks. The app is now seeing roughly 300,000 new installs per day — up from under 200,000 previously.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Anthropic brings Claude Code to the web
articles.summary: Anthropic now lets developers spin up Claude Code agents, and manage them, from their web browser on desktop and mobile.

articles.title: OpenEvidence, the ChatGPT for doctors, raises $200M at $6B valuation
articles.summary: Trained on medical journals like JAMA and the New England Journal of Medicine, the platform helps users quickly get answers to existing medical knowledge to help treat patients.  Verified medical prof.
articles.content: Trained on medical journals like JAMA and the New England Journal of Medicine, the platform helps users quickly get answers to existing medical knowledge to help treat patients. Verified medical professionals can access OpenEvidence’s tool, which is supported by advertising, for free.
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan

articles.author: Ryan Daws

articles.title: Wikipedia says traffic is falling due to AI search summaries and social video

articles.title: Should AI do everything? OpenAI thinks so
articles.summary: Silicon Valley’s rule.  It’s not cool to be cautious.

articles.title: Facebook’s AI can now suggest edits to the photos still on your phone
articles.summary: Facebook is rolling out a new Meta AI photo suggestion feature across the U.  and Canada that lets its AI recommend edits to images stored on users’ camera rolls — even if they haven’t been shared.
articles.content: Facebook is rolling out a new Meta AI photo suggestion feature across the U.S. and Canada that lets its AI recommend edits to images stored on users’ camera rolls — even if they haven’t been shared. The feature is currently opt-in only.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.content: The South Korean government spent 1.2 trillion won ($850m) on developing AI textbooks for schools, but the national programme has been rolled back after just four months, amid allegations of inaccurate texts, concerns about privacy, and increased workloads on staff and pupils.
